elementMetadata.description: Add an SAP Anywhere Instance to connect your existing SAP Anywhere account to the eCommerce Hub, allowing you to manage customers, orders and products across multiple eCommerce Elements. You will need your SAP Anywhere account information to add an instance.
elementMetadata.name: SAP Anywhere

configuration.description: SAP Anywhere OAuth Token Refresh URL
configuration.name: OAuth Token Refresh URL

configuration.description: SAP Anywhere OAuth Token Revoke URL
configuration.name: OAuth Token Revoke URL

configuration.description: Enables use of global fields query parameter to filter response to only specified fields. This will override any existing vendor functionality on the connector
configuration.name: Allow Select Fields parameter

configuration.description: SAP Anywhere Max Page Size (or limit)
configuration.name: Max Page Size (or limit)

configuration.description: SAP Anywhere Event Notification Signature Key
configuration.name: Event Notification Signature Key

configuration.description: Used to enable/disable filtering of null values from the responses.
configuration.name: Filter null values from the response

configuration.description: Generic map used to specify default fields for bulk download and GET /all requests. Each key should be the canonical objectName and values may be specified as a comma-delimited string or a list of strings
configuration.name: Default select fields

description: Add an SAP Anywhere Instance to connect your existing SAP Anywhere account to the eCommerce Hub, allowing you to manage customers, orders and products across multiple eCommerce Elements. You will need your SAP Anywhere account information to add an instance.

resources.description: Search for customers

parameters.description: The CEQL search expression. The operators available are "=", "!=", ">", ">=", "<", "<=", "AND" and "OR". An example of a single where query would be firstName = 'Brian' . An example of a multiple where query would be firstName = 'Brian' AND creationTime > '2016-07-06T20:39:55.409Z'
parameters.name: where

parameters.description: The number of results to fetch in a given page. When this parameter is omitted, a maximum of 200 results are returned.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The page number. When this parameter is omitted, 1 is implied.
parameters.name: page

resources.description: Create a customer

parameters.description: The Customer object to be created
parameters.name: customer

resources.description: Get the count of the matching customers.

parameters.description: The CEQL search expression. An example would be firstName = 'Brian'
parameters.name: where

resources.description: Retrieve a customer

parameters.description: The ID of the customer to retrieve from the eCommerce system.
parameters.name: id

resources.description: Update a customer

parameters.description: The ID of the customer to update in the eCommerce system.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The customer object, with those fields that are to be updated.
parameters.name: customer

parameters.description: The number of resources to return in a given page
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The page number of resources to retrieve
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Indicate whether to include meta information for the attachment, default to false
parameters.name: true

parameters.name: multipart/form-data

Search for sales orders

parameters.description: The page number of resources to retrieve
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The number of resources to return in a given page
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The CEQL search expression. The operators available are "=", "!=", ">", ">=", "<", "<=", "AND" and "OR". An example of a single where query would be pricingMethod = 'GROSS_PRICE' . An example of a multiple where query would be pricingMethod = 'GROSS_PRICE' AND orderType = 'SELL_ORDER'
parameters.name: where

resources.description: Create a sales order using the given data.

parameters.description: JSON data of the sales order to be created.
parameters.name: orders

resources.description: Get the count of the matching sales orders.

parameters.description: The CEQL search expression. The operators available are "=", "!=", ">", ">=", "<", "<=", "AND" and "OR". An example of a single where query would be pricingMethod = 'GROSS_PRICE' . An example of a multiple where query would be pricingMethod = 'GROSS_PRICE' AND orderType = 'SELL_ORDER'
parameters.name: where

parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The CEQL search expression. The operators available are "=", "!=", ">", ">=", "<", "<=", "AND" and "OR". An example of a single where query would be updateTime >= '2016-08-30T17:44:30.497Z' . An example of a multiple where query would be name = 'Cotton shirt' AND status = 'Active'
parameters.name: where

parameters.description: The number of resources to return in a given page
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: Selecting a set of fields. An example would be id,name,code
parameters.name: fields

Disable inventory for a product. After disabling this, the product will change the status to SingleService or VariantService
Enable inventory for a product. After enabling this, the product can create the multi SKUs and remove the default one
Disable variants for a product. After disabling this, the product will remove all the related SKUs and create a default one
Enable variants for a product. After enabling this, the product can create the multi SKUs and remove the default one
